columns.text: In this problem, we need to determine average colection period for the company Kyoto Joe, Inc. and average balance sheet amount in accounts receivable using the given data.

**a)** Company Kyoto Joe, Inc. offers terms of $2/10$, net $30$. So, buyers can take a $2$ percent discount from the full price if you pay within
$10$ days, or pay the full amount in $30$ days. Based on previous experience, the company has estimated that $70$ percent of its customers take advantage of the discount.

**b)**  Company Kyoto Joe, Inc. sells $1,120$  forecasts every month at a price of $\$1,580$ each. The  average balance sheet amount in accounts receivable is 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Accounts receivable}&=\text{Average daily sales}\cdot \text{ACP}\\[15pt]
&=\frac{\text{Total annual sales}}{365}\cdot \text{ACP}\\[15pt]
&=\frac{\$1,580\cdot 1,120\cdot 12}{365}\cdot 16\\[15pt]
&=\frac{\$21,235,200}{365}\cdot 16\\[15pt]
&=\$930,858.08\\
\end{align*}$$
Hence, the accounts receivable is $930,858.08,
